metadata.title: CVE-2021-46877 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
jackson-databind 2.10.x through 2.12.x before 2.12.6 and 2.13.x before 2.13.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (2 GB transient heap usage per read) in uncommon situations involving JsonNode JDK serialization.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46877` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjackson2-databind-java - 2.13.2.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jackson-databind package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.13.2.2-1').
